patch:
diff --git a/Include/refcount.h b/Include/refcount.h
index 177bbdaf0c5..20d810722e7 100644
--- a/Include/refcount.h
+++ b/Include/refcount.h
@@ -490,7 +490,7 @@ static inline Py_ALWAYS_INLINE void Py_DECREF(PyObject *op)
     do { \
         _Py_TYPEOF(op)* _tmp_op_ptr = &(op); \
         _Py_TYPEOF(op) _tmp_old_op = (*_tmp_op_ptr); \
-        if (_tmp_old_op != NULL) { \
+        if (_tmp_old_op != NULL && (void *)_tmp_old_op != (void *)-1) { \
             *_tmp_op_ptr = _Py_NULL; \
             Py_DECREF(_tmp_old_op); \
         } \
error:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/gentest-cpython/py-pr-134064/generated_2.py", line 31, in <module>
    rc, out, err = assert_python_ok('-c', code)
                   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/tmp/py-pr-134064/build/Lib/test/support/script_helper.py", line 182, in assert_python_ok
    return _assert_python(True, *args, **env_vars)
  File "/tmp/py-pr-134064/build/Lib/test/support/script_helper.py", line 167, in _assert_python
    res.fail(cmd_line)
    ~~~~~~~~^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/tmp/py-pr-134064/build/Lib/test/support/script_helper.py", line 80, in fail
    raise AssertionError(f"Process return code is {exitcode}\n"
    ...<10 lines>...
                         f"---")
AssertionError: Process return code is 1
command line: ['/tmp/py-pr-134064/build/python', '-X', 'faulthandler', '-I', '-c', "if 1:\n    import sys\n\n    # Some builds or versions might not have sys.remote_exec; guard to avoid false failures.\n    if not hasattr(sys, 'remote_exec'):\n        print('SKIP: sys.remote_exec not available')\n    else:\n        def expect_typeerror(arg, label):\n            try:\n                # pid value is irrelevant for this test; we focus on the script arg conversion.\n                sys.remote_exec(0, arg)\n                print('NO_TYPEERROR', label)\n            except TypeError as e:\n                # Ensure we got a TypeError, which indicates the converter failure is now correctly handled.\n                print('TypeError', label)\n\n        # These arguments are not valid path-like objects and should cause TypeError\n        expect_typeerror(None, 'NoneType')\n        expect_typeerror(123, 'int')\n        expect_typeerror(object(), 'object')\n"]
